column3: Description
A measurement along some dimension
column9: Scales are subjective concepts that need to be defined and interpreted within the context of their application. For example, what would be small within one context could be large within another.
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Rana Saniei

column3: Volume or Scale of Data
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Rana Saniei

column3: Data volume that is considered huge or more than large within the context
Data volume that is considered large within the context
Data volume that is considered medium i.e. neither large nor small within the context
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Paul Ryan

column3: Data volume that is considered small or limited within the context
Data volume that is considered sporadic or sparse within the context
Data volume that is considered singular i.e. a specific instance or single item
Scale of Data Subject(s)
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Rana Saniei

column3: Scale of data subjects considered huge or more than large within the context
Scale of data subjects considered large within the context
Scale of data subjects considered medium i.e. neither large nor small within the context
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Paul Ryan

column3: Scale of data subjects considered small or limited within the context
Scale of data subjects considered sporadic or sparse within the context
Scale of data subjects considered singular i.e. a specific data subject
Indicate of scale in terms of geographic coverage
column14: Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Georg P Krog, Paul Ryan

column3: Geographic coverage spanning the entire globe
Geographic coverage nearly spanning the entire globe
Geographic coverage spanning multiple nations
Geographic coverage spanning a nation
Geographic coverage spanning a specific region or regions
Geographic coverage spanning a specific locality
column9: For example, geographic scale of a city or an area within a city

column3: Geographic coverage spanning a specific environment within the locality
column9: For example, geographic scale of an event take place in a specific building or room

column3: Scale of Processing
column9: The exact definition of what constitutes "scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending the scales provided with the appropriate context.

column3: Processing that takes place at large scales (as specified by some criteria)
column9: The exact definition of what constitutes "large scale" depends on use of jurisdictional, domain-specific, or other forms of externally defined criterias. Where possible, this should be reflected by extending this term with the appropriate context.

column3: Processing that takes place at medium scales (as specified by some criteria)
Processing that takes place at small scales (as specified by some criteria)
